data.question: What is the empirical formula for Mg-rho-ZMOF?
data.answer: C20 H20 In2 Mg N8 O22

data.question: What is the crystal system and space group of Mg-rho-ZMOF?
At what temperature were the crystal data for Mg-rho-ZMOF collected?
What is the formula weight of Mg-rho-ZMOF?
How many unique reflections were collected for Mg-rho-ZMOF?
What is the final R index (I>2sigma(I)) for Mg-rho-ZMOF?
What is the unit cell volume of Mg-rho-ZMOF?
What is the calculated density of Mg-rho-ZMOF?
Is the Mg(II) cation in Mg-rho-ZMOF directly accessible for binding the adsorbed hydrogen molecules?
data.answer: No, the Mg(II) cation is in the form of a hexaaqua complex and not directly accessible.

data.question: Does the presence of an electrostatic field in the cavity of ZMOFs contribute to the increased binding energies for hydrogen storage?
data.answer: Yes, the presence of an electrostatic field in the cavity is largely responsible for the observed improvement in the isosteric heats of adsorption.

data.question: Are the extra-framework cations in ZMOFs fully coordinated by aqua ligands?
Is the isosteric heat of adsorption for H2 in Mg-rho-ZMOF greater than that in DMA-rho-ZMOF at low loadings?
Can the adsorbed H2 molecules interact directly with the extra-framework cations in ZMOFs?
Is the crystal system of Mg-rho-ZMOF hexagonal?
Does the Li-rho-ZMOF have a higher concentration of Li ions per unit cell compared to Mg-rho-ZMOF?
Is the isosteric heat of adsorption for H2 in Li-rho-ZMOF lower than in Mg-rho-ZMOF?
Does heating Mg-rho-ZMOF beyond 115 °C result in the removal of aqua ligands from the extra-framework cations?
data.answer: False, heating beyond this temperature results in progressive degradation of the framework.
